name: UpdateGoalRelationship
description:
Update an existing goal relationship in Asana.

Use this tool to update specific fields of an existing goal relationship in Asana. Provide only the fields you wish to change, as unspecified fields will remain unchanged.

parameters.name: goal_relationship_unique_id
parameters.description: The globally unique identifier for the specific goal relationship to be updated.

value_schema.description: Globally unique identifier for the goal relationship.

parameters.name: updated_goal_fields
parameters.description: A JSON object containing the fields to update in the goal relationship.

value_schema.description: The updated fields for the goal relationship.

parameters.name: include_optional_properties
parameters.description: Specify properties to include in the response. Provide as a list of property names, which will include optional fields in the returned goal relationship.

value_schema.description: This endpoint returns a resource which excludes some properties by default. To include those optional properties, set this query parameter to a comma-separated list of the properties you wish to include.

parameters.name: enable_pretty_output
parameters.description: Set to true for a readable response with indentation. Increases response size/time, recommended for debugging.

value_schema.description:
Provides “pretty” output.
Provides the response in a “pretty” format. In the case of JSON this means doing proper line breaking and indentation to make it readable. This will take extra time and increase the response size so it is advisable only to use this during debugging.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the asana API.

parameters.name: opt_pretty
parameters.description:
Provides “pretty” output.
Provides the response in a “pretty” format. In the case of JSON this means doing proper line breaking and indentation to make it readable. This will take extra time and increase the response size so it is advisable only to use this during debugging.

value_schema.description:
Provides “pretty” output.
Provides the response in a “pretty” format. In the case of JSON this means doing proper line breaking and indentation to make it readable. This will take extra time and increase the response size so it is advisable only to use this during debugging.

parameters.name: opt_fields
parameters.description: This endpoint returns a resource which excludes some properties by default. To include those optional properties, set this query parameter to a comma-separated list of the properties you wish to include.

value_schema.description: This endpoint returns a resource which excludes some properties by default. To include those optional properties, set this query parameter to a comma-separated list of the properties you wish to include.

parameters.name: goal_relationship_gid
parameters.description: Globally unique identifier for the goal relationship.

value_schema.description: Globally unique identifier for the goal relationship.

parameters.name: requestBody
parameters.description: The updated fields for the goal relationship.

value_schema.description: The updated fields for the goal relationship.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
